abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Emergency Living Conditions Improvement Support Project for
            Congo is to assist the Government in improving living
            conditions by strengthening the socio economic situation in
            key urban centers and in two isolated areas - i.e.: (i)
            improving delivery of basic services in provincial capitals
            and key medium urban centers; and (ii) restoring key
            transport links to reconnect two isolated regions. The main
            reason for the restructuring is to modify the scope and
            design of the project by closing component C, with a current
            disbursement rate of 92 percent, and component D, which
            remains undisbursed as most of the activities were financed
            by the Government and the provinces and the remaining will
            be financed by the donors.  The unused funds will be
            reallocated for use under components A and B to ensure that
            the Project Development Objective (PDO) can be achieved by
            the new completion date of September 30, 2011. The changes
            will not have a major effect on the original economic and
            social aspects of the project.
